question: A client program requests and receives services from a server program.
Packet switching is more efficient in using link capacity than circuit switching.
The application-layer message and the transport-layer header information together constitute the network-layer segment.
The total nodal delay is given by the sum of processing delay and propagation delay.
Store-and-forward transmission means that the switch must receive the entire packet before it can begin to transmit the first bit of the packet onto the outbound link.
Each router has a forwarding table that maps source addresses to outbound links.
Tier-2 ISPs are directly connected to all Tier-1 ISPs.
Transport Layer and Network Layer are always executed together.
IP is a connectionless protocol.
Without DNS, it is impossible to communicate with servers where only the hostnames are known.
Web cashing can reduce the delay in receiving a requested object of a webpage.
FTP uses UDP as its underlying transport protocol.
SMTP decides how a Web page is interpreted by a Web browser.
When a user requests a Web page, only one TCP connection may be generated.

File distribution using P2P architecture. Upload rate: server is 10Mbps and each client 2 Mbps. Download rate:each client is 10Mbps. There are 100 clients and the file is 12,5Mbytes. The minimum distribution time is about 50 seconds.
A BitTorrent peer A may upload to a peer B even if B is not sending anything to A.
P2P can be used for instant messaging.
A HTTP web server uses persistent connections. The server spawns a separate process for each client that connects to the server. Each of these processes will have different server port numbers.
In a POP3 transaction, the user agent issues commands, and the server responds to each command with a reply.
SIP is used to transfer voice packets between two communicating peers.
A transport-layer protocol can provide reliable data transfer only when the underlying network layer also provides reliable service.

Suppose Host A sends two TCP segments back to back to Host B over a TCP connection. The first segment has sequence number 100; the second has sequence number 200. Then, there are 200 bytes in the first segment.
In Go-back-N, the sender is allowed to transmit multiple packets (when available) without waiting for an acknowledgement from the receiver.
The throughput of a UDP connection is typically a function of the round-trip time between the sender and the receiver.
When TCP is used, the TCP port number of the receiver must be the same as the TCP port number of the sender.
UDP is a connectionless transport protocol.
TCP provides a reliable, simplex service to the Network layer.
Flow control is needed because a sender may have too much data to send.
For every write() to a TCP streamsocket, there must be a corresponding read() at the other end to receive the data.
TCP uses different TCP protocol headers for connection set-up and close.
The IP address 192.32.158.3 in binary notation is:11000000 00100000 11011000 00000011
A subnet, which has a CIDR address of the form a.b.c.d/24, can accommodate about 500 hosts.
Routers typically only look at the network part and not the host part of the IP address.
A datagram is a packet that is transferred independently of other packets.
In a distance-vector routing algorithm, each router has a map of the entire network and determines the shortest path from itself to all other routers in the network.
In a decentralized routing algorithm, the calculation of the least-cost path is carried out in an iterative, distributed manner.
The IPv4 address space is much larger than the IPv6 address space.
Scalability and administrative autonomy are two important reasons for organizing the Internet as a hierarchy of networks.
With DHCP, a host will be assigned an IP address that is same each time the host is connected to the network.
Network address translation (NAT) is used in the Internet to translate between IP addresses found in separate sub-networks.
Because a switch isolates one link from another, the different links in the LAN can operate at different speeds.
The point-to-point protocol (PPP) is a link-layer protocol for point-to-point links, able to support multiple network-layer protocols.
Forward error correction (FEC) can decrease the number of sender retransmissions required.
For the Internet, it is the job of the Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) to translate between IP addresses and MAC addresses.
The maximum efficiency of slotted ALOHA is lower than the maximum efficiency of pure ALOHA.
It is not a node (i.e., host or router) that has a link-layer address but instead it is a node's adapter that has a link-layer address.
Unlike IP addresses that have a hierarchical structure, an adapter's MAC address has a flat structure.
An adapter's MAC address does not change no matter where the adapter is installed.
With CSMA/CD, when a collision is detected, the transmitting node stops its transmission and uses some protocol to determine when it should attempt to transmit the next time.
For a given signal-to-noise ratio (SNR), a modulation technique with a higher bit transmission rate will have a higher bit-error-rate (BER).
